qas.question: How large is the Marshall Islands shark sanctuary in square miles?
In what month and year did the Marshall Islands declare the largest shark sanctuary in the world?
In how many square miles of ocean around the world are sharks protected?
What is forbidden in shark sanctuaries?

context: In <a1_0>October 2011<a1_0/>, the government declared that an area covering nearly 2,000,000 square kilometres (<a0_0>772,000<a0_0/> sq mi) of ocean shall be reserved as a shark sanctuary. This is the world's largest shark sanctuary, extending the worldwide ocean area in which sharks are protected from 2,700,000 to 4,600,000 square kilometres (1,042,000 to <a2_0>1,776,000<a2_0/> sq mi). In protected waters, all <a3_0>shark fishing<a3_0/> is banned and all by-catch must be released. However, some have questioned the ability of the Marshall Islands to enforce this zone.
